channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: For first-time Grammy nominee Michael Mayo, vocal expression is innate
item.description: Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly, with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his career.
item.content:encoded:
Fly, earned the jazz vocalist his first Grammy nominations of his career.'/>

Vocalist Michael Mayo reached new heights through his latest album Fly, with the project earning the crooner his first Grammy nominations of his career.

(Image credit: Lauren Desberg)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: 'Sound of Falling' is a hypnotic history of German rural life
item.description: The German film Sound of Falling compels and disturbs in equal measure.
item.content:encoded:
The German film Sound of Falling compels and disturbs in equal measure.

(Image credit: Fabian Gamper)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Jonah Wolpert

item.title: So you're buying tickets for Harry Styles' tour. Can artists control the prices?
item.description: For years, fans have complained about what it can take to get a concert ticket: the long virtual queue waits, website crashes and high prices. Now, the artists' role in it all are being questioned.
item.content:encoded:
For years, fans have complained about what it can take to get a concert ticket: the long virtual queue waits, website crashes and high prices. Now, the artists' role in it all are being questioned.

(Image credit: Joel C Ryan)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: 'KPop Demon Hunters' HUNTR/X conquer the charts and claim their destiny
item.description: The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.
item.content:encoded:
The fictional band HUNTR/X from the hit Netflix film KPop Demon Hunters went from a group no one had ever heard of to one of the biggest pop acts of 2025. Now they have five Grammy nominations.

(Image credit: Lauren Crew for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: 'Fireworks' wins Caldecott, Newbery is awarded to 'All the Blues in the Sky'
item.description: The best books for children and young adults were awarded the country's top honors by the American Library Association on Monday.
item.content:encoded: The best books for children and young adults were awarded the country's top honors by the American Library Association on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: How did Tucker Carlson become one of the far right's most influential voices?
item.description: Writer Jason Zengerle says Carlson had the foresight to see Trump's potential in 2015. Now he's someone the president "definitely listens to." Zengerle's new book is Hated by All the Right People.
item.content:encoded:
Writer Jason Zengerle says Carlson had the foresight to see Trump's potential in 2015. Now he's someone the president "definitely listens to." Zengerle's new book is Hated by All the Right People.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: A kids' guide to phone-free fun, from the author of 'The Anxious Generation'
item.description: Jonathan Haidt's 2024 book made the case that screen time had "rewired" kids' brains. The Amazing Generation is a collab with science journalist Catherine Price and graphic novelist Cynthia Yuan Cheng.
item.content:encoded:
The Anxious Generation made the case that smartphones and social media had "rewired" kids' brains. His new book, The Amazing Generation, is a collaboration with science journalist Catherine Price and graphic novelist Cynthia Yuan Cheng.'/>

Jonathan Haidt's 2024 book made the case that screen time had "rewired" kids' brains. The Amazing Generation is a collab with science journalist Catherine Price and graphic novelist Cynthia Yuan Cheng.
item.dc:creator: Tahneer Oksman

item.title: Here to Help: In Baton Rouge, kids get a free and safe place to go after school
item.description: A poor neighborhood in Baton Rouge, La., has a volunteer initiative that's making a difference for the children there.
item.content:encoded: A poor neighborhood in Baton Rouge, La., has a volunteer initiative that's making a difference for the children there.
item.dc:creator: Alex Cox

item.title: Neighbors and church members transformed the home of a man with terminal cancer
item.description: In 2007, Larry Maxfield helped his brother Marty move to Utah. Marty had terminal cancer. Neighbors and church members helped transform Marty's new house into a warm home during his final days.
item.content:encoded: In 2007, Larry Maxfield helped his brother Marty move to Utah. Marty had terminal cancer. Neighbors and church members helped transform Marty's new house into a warm home during his final days.

item.title: How a 1984 NYC subway shooting let to the politics of resentment we see today
item.description: In Fear and Fury, historian Heather Ann Thompson revisits Bernhard Goetz's shooting of four Black teens — and explains how the incident reshaped criminal justice, national policy and media coverage.
item.content:encoded: In Fear and Fury, historian Heather Ann Thompson revisits Bernhard Goetz's shooting of four Black teens — and explains how the incident reshaped criminal justice, national policy and media coverage.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley
